decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed rear dormer roof extension on the roof of the outrigger by reason of its combined siting, height and depth results in an overbearing and visually intrusive form of development that would adversely impact on the outlook and potentially daylight and sunlight from the first floor habitable room window on the recessed rear elevation of the adjoining occupant and thus adversely impact on the residential amenity of the adjoining occupants, in particular no. 8 Richmond Avenue.  The scheme would fails to comply with the aims and objectives of, in particular, policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan, LBM Core Strategy (2011) CS14.

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY SIDE AND REAR EXTENSION,REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION ON MAIN ROOF AND OUTRIGGER, RAISING OF CHIMNEY AND TWO VELUX WINDOW TO THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE.
